description.narrative:
Uganda Refugee and Disaster Management Council: Project Title: Emergency Food security and Livelihood for Youth in Bidibidi Camp-Yumbe District.
The project is in line with the recent assessments conducted by Agencies in Humanitarian response compiled and shared by UNHCR and OPM. Some of the findings indicated gaps like both host community and refugee youth high unemployment rates, gender and protection concerns.
The two month project will be implemented in BidiBidi refugee settlement in Yumbe targeting at least 2 zones within the Camp. This will be decided and discussed with Oxfam, UNCHR and OPM which of the zones could be piloted. Activities that support refugee relocation and protection in Koboko and Arua to Yumbe would also be implemented.
The aim of the project is to promote the refugees# self-reliance through short and long-term professional income- and food-securing opportunities. This project will protect and promote the dignity of refugees, promote a common set of key values, including non-violent communication, tolerance and human rights. Finally, it will diminish the crime rate in Yumbe refugee settlement. The involvement of the refugee and the host communities at all levels will strengthen their confidence and will enhance the life quality of those involved as well as promotes peaceful coexistence For the identification, referral and support for GBV and human rights abuse-the Working with community-based mechanisms (gender and social protection committees as well as peer counsellors and local leaders), identify and refer victims of GBV andhuman rights abuse who need further support (medical and legal support to the appropriate services, and follow up as necessary. Throughout the group formation process, URDMC will ensure tocreate a gender and age balance. In line with the do-no-harm principles, both refugee and host communities will be targeted to strengthen peaceful coexistence. We also see the need to bring refugees of different tribes together to promote exchange and knowledge-sharing among the refugee community, use of local resources and resource persons would also be key to enhance local and cheap available skills. Throughout the project Implementation the goals to be realised are: 1) A secured livelihood for the youth, which has been experiencing a life without any perspective throughout the last month(s). 2) It would also address the increasing crime rate reported in the refugee settlement of Yumbe and its surrounding areas. Consequently, a safer and more sustainable environment will be created, which will # without doubt # mean a better quality of life for refugees of all ages and an enhanced relationship with the host community. 3) Peaceful coexistence status of refugee and host community would mean a good environment to foster economic activities of refugees/host community members that would translate into improved livelihoods as well as economic activities that will contribute to the growth of the Country#s GDP in the long run.

participating-org.narrative: UGANDA REFUGEE & DISASTER MGT COU COUNCIL

Uganda Refugee and Disaster Management Council (URDMC) is a registered Ugandan-based Non-Governmental Organization registration No: S.5914/9502 with its Headquarter in Gulu and Field Office located on Gulu-Adjumani Road, adjacent to Pakele Police Post, Pakele Town Board. The organization was founded in 2012 with aims of protection of refugee#s rights through Food Distribution and Ware house management. URDMC partnered with MOBAN in collaboration with GIZ International in the implementation of Peace building project within Nakivale Refugees# Settlement-Western Uganda in 2012/2013. URDMC in close collaboration with OPM in South Western Uganda also contributed towards the emergency response for the Congolese Refugees in Matanda Transit Centre. In partnership with Apparel Art Uganda,URDMC is supporting child mothers in Northern Uganda with the aim of economically empowering them to exercise their rights and meettheir basic needs through creative arts and designs.
The Vision is: To be the leading organization in the protection of refugees#right and people affected by conflict and disaster# and the Mission is : #To promote and protect the rights of people who havebeen forced to flee their countries or their home regardless of their race, religion, nationality or political affiliations#.
The organisation has over three (3) years# experience in working with the people affected by disaster and conflict, especially the vulnerable children, youth and women to rebuild their lives and to promote peaceful co-existence and sustainable livelihoods in the community. URDMC believes that all people are equal and have the right to determine and direct their development, and to live in dignity regardless of background, status, and tribe, political and religious affiliation

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
